bug.author: Ryandry1st
bug.description:
Thank you for submitting a TensorFlow documentation issue. Per our GitHub policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests, and build/installation issues on GitHub. The TensorFlow docs are open source! To get involved, read the documentation contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
site/en/r2/tutorials/generative/cvae.ipynb <denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing): implement @tf.function decorators in the computation to improve performance, and highlight one of the tf 2.0 features.</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
When implementing in colab the performance improves from 30s / epoch average to 3.6s /epoch which is a huge benefit, and well worth highlighting/recommending by adding only 4 lines of code. <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
I can do that, yes Are you planning to also submit a pull request to fix the issue? See the docs contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link> and the docs style guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_style>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs_style</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Pull request is submitted, approved, and merged. Website docs just need to be updated to include recent code merge.

Automatically closing this out since I understand it to be resolved by the PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/pull/871>tensorflow/docs#871</denchmark-link> . Thanks for the contribution.
